node.title: Weekly UK COVID deaths up 45 percent
node.description: Britain has seen a record spike in infections in recent weeks.
node.content: ["The UK reported 81,713 new cases of COVID-19 on Saturday, leaving the seven-day tally down by nearly 33 percent on the previous week.\n", "Britain also reported 287 deaths of people who had tested positive for the disease within the previous 28 days. The seven-day total for deaths was up 45 percent on the week before, following a record spike in infections in recent weeks.\u00a0", "It comes as UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson is set to lift 'Plan B' COVID restrictions in England, the Telegraph reported.", "'Plan B' introduced COVID passports and work from home guidance, but those restrictions are widely expected to be lifted from January 26 for England, The Telegraph said, adding some rules on face masks may remain.\u00a0", "An announcement could come as soon as this week, the newspaper said.", "On Friday, the government published minutes from a January 7 meeting of the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies that said the epidemic had the potential to continue to grow nationally.", "The group also warned if there were a reversal of current interventions like Plan B in England, before the peak in infection was passed it could lead to an increase in the overall impact of the wave on hospitalisations.", "Johnson said last week England could withstand a surge in COVID-19 infections without shutting down the economy, resisting imposing stringent lockdown measures.\u00a0"]
